channel.title: Dave Winer's linkblog
channel.description: The continuation of a tradition that goes back to Radio UserLand in 2002.

item.description: SkyBridge is a magical server that translates Mastodon requests into Bluesky ones, allowing you to unlock the power of incredible Mastodon apps like Ivory and use them on the Bluesky network.
item.source:markdown: SkyBridge is a magical server that translates Mastodon requests into Bluesky ones, allowing you to unlock the power of incredible Mastodon apps like Ivory and use them on the Bluesky network.

item.description: I asked ChatGPT to write me another story about Leon Smuk, the South African milk entrepreneur with millions of cows and an AI chatbot to help him to not go crazy. I laughed out loud. üòÇ

item.description: We expect freedom of choice on both ends with podcasting, now I want to see that same freedom with text. That means you can write using any editor, and people can read wherever they like to read. We can have that kind of freedom.
item.source:markdown: We expect freedom of choice on both ends with podcasting, now I want to see that same freedom with text. That means you can write using any editor, and people can read wherever they like to read. We can have that kind of freedom.

item.description: Now that we have RSS feeds for Bluesky, people who don't have accounts can see what's going on, without resorting to screen shots. For example, one of my favorite feeds is the NYT feed, where they post results of various AI experiments.
item.source:markdown: Now that we have RSS feeds for Bluesky, people who don't have accounts can see what's going on, without resorting to screen shots. For example, one of my favorite feeds is the NYT feed, where they post results of various AI experiments.

item.description: My grandfather who ran from the Nazis warned me about people like Musk.

item.description: I think that net-net Bluesky is a good thing, because it guarantees we'll have at least two incompatible social internets. Had they supported ActivityPub that would probably have slowed everything down to the pace of something like Ecmascript.
item.source:markdown: I think that net-net Bluesky is a good thing, because it guarantees we'll have at least two incompatible social internets. Had they supported ActivityPub that would probably have slowed everything down to the pace of something like Ecmascript.

item.description: The MetaWeblog API came out on March 14, 2002. Luckily I have the archive of my blog for that day. We were very much aware of what we were doing.
item.source:markdown: The MetaWeblog API came out on March 14, 2002\. Luckily I have the archive of my blog for that day. We were very much aware of what we were doing.

item.description: We're in that part of the year where first the marketers torture me with the reminder that my mother is dead, and then when that wasn't enough do the same with the memory of my poor father. I hope my parents would laugh at this. I think they would. üòÄ
item.source:markdown: We're in that part of the year where first the marketers torture me with the reminder that my mother is dead, and then when that wasn't enough do the same with the memory of my poor father. I hope my parents would laugh at this. I think they would. üòÄ

item.description: If you're working at the api-level with Bluesky, Mastodon, Nostr -- please consider supporting the Metaweblog API as an interface to your code. Lots of developers know how to work with it. It's the main API for WordPress. Stood the test of time.
item.source:markdown: If you're working at the api-level with Bluesky, Mastodon, Nostr -- please consider supporting the Metaweblog API as an interface to your code. Lots of developers know how to work with it. It's the main API for WordPress. Stood the test of time.

item.description: It‚Äôs smart that Artifact is focusing on writers, someday it‚Äôll be hard to believe there was a time social nets didn‚Äôt, but just give us the freedom to use our own writing tools, and don‚Äôt try to trap us in your silo, that‚Äôs where it begins, not with metrics.
